title.narrative: Building Resilience and Capacities for Emerging Disasters (BRACED)

description.narrative: In the Shelter Sector following activities are planned: (1) Participatory Approach for Safe Shelter Awareness (PASSA) assessment, (2) Participatory Risk Assessment and Hazard Mapping, (3) Household infrastructure hazard mitigation through retrofitting 250 households structures, (4) Provision of financial assistance for Safer Shelter to 300 households to improve their shelter structure, (5) At least 4 community identified micro-projects in each of the three neighborhoods, totaling 12 micro-projects, (6) Community builder training program in disaster risk reduction (DRR)-appropriate construction methods, (7) Professional construction training for semi-experienced and professionalized trainees in plumbing, masonry, and carpentry, (8) Three pilot-scale neighborhood-based redevelopment plans built on key DRR planning and preparedness initiatives, (9) Three Community Resource Centers established to centralize coalition-building, technical assistance, training, resource-sharing, and information dissemination, (10) DRR Community Councils with effective representation from the parish, municipal and community council, the local private sector, and University of the West Indies. In the WASH sector: (1) Sanitation asset and site mapping, resulting in 10-12 maps used to inform micro-projects as needed, (2) Community-driven site selection, installation and management of 21 Ventilated Improved Double Pit units to meet collective and household sanitation needs, (3) 21 community members trained as trainers and ambassadors to lead all WASH capacity building, awareness activities, and behavior change, (4) Each sub-community will map critical water supply infrastructure, resulting in 10-12 maps used to inform micro-projects as needed, (5) Water Supply Plan: Sub-communities will develop a water supply plan based on mapping and hazard exposure of local, critical water supply sources, totaling three plans, and (6) To support water supply planning, BRACED program staff will train and engage community members in water testing using the DelAgua water quality tests in each community to inform planning.

The BRACED project assists three of the most vulnerable communities in Portmore, Jamaica in creating development plans, preparing for disasters and building capacities to face hazards prone to those communities. Habitat for Humanity is working in close collaboration with municipal and national authorities, as well as direct private sector involvement in disaster risk reduction. The project furthermore sets example in disaster prone housing, water and sanitation infrastructure and build capacities in construction techniques both at individual level and institutional level, through partnerships with vocational education institutions and national universities.
